alert.note: Alert for Renville; Ward (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 25 at 2:06PM CST until December 26 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches with locally higher amounts possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and north central North Dakota. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, late tonight through Sunday morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday afternoon through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...For Sunday afternoon through Monday morning, roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. Late tonight through Sunday morning, dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors, make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
